column3: Added check-ignore command for git integration to allow check if separate pathname/filename under .gitignore. To see specification for command click on link check-ignore
Doesn't git ls-files --ignored solve the task?

@klikh git ls-files --ignored shows list of all ignored paths and you need to check all list to find out if your pathname under .gitignore. git check-ignore pathname checks only selected pathname without additional actions
Nope, you can still give a path to ls-files as well. For example:
@klikh Thank you so much! ls-files is much more powerful than I imagined before.
